answers.1: Small, shallow ulcer, minor devitalized tissue.
answers.2: Deep ulcer with limited osteotendinous exposure and gangrene.
answers.3: Extensive deep ulcer with full exposure, extensive gangrene.

answers.0: No symptoms or signs of infection.
answers.1: Superficial localized infection, 2 cm erythema, No SIRS.
answers.2: Deep localized infection, 2 cm erythema, No SIRS.

answers.1: Significant lesion in SFA ˂ 10 cm or CTO ˂ 5 cm / Poplitea with non-significant lesions.
answers.2: Significant lesion in SFA 10-20 cm or CTO ˂ 10 cm / Poplitea with significant lesions ˂ 2 cm.
answers.3: Significant lesion in SFA ˃ 20 cm or CTO 10-20 cm / Popliteal with significant lesions 2-5 cm
answers.4: Significant lesion in SFA 20 cm or CTO ˃20 cm / Poplitea with significant lesions ˃ 5 cm that compromise trifurcation.

answers.2: Diffuse disease involving 1/3 of the vessel, CTO ˂ 3 cm.
answers.3: Diffuse disease involving 2/3 of the vessel, CTO 1/3 of the vessel.
answers.4: Diffuse disease involving 2/3 of the vessel, CTO 1/3 of the vessel, involvement of the tibioperoneal trunk.
